title: Conditional Statement Truth Explorer
description: Interactive exploration of when conditional statements are true or false based on hypothesis and conclusion truth values. Students toggle hypothesis and conclusion states to observe how the conditional's truth value changes.
creator: Dan McCreary
subject: Geometry
Mathematics
Logic
Conditional Statements
learningObjectives: Evaluate the truth value of conditional statements by testing different combinations of hypothesis and conclusion truth values
Identify counterexamples where a true hypothesis leads to a false conclusion
Understand the truth table for conditional statements
prerequisites: Understanding of conditional statement structure (hypothesis and conclusion)
Familiarity with if-then language in geometry

controls.label: Hypothesis: TRUE/FALSE
controls.description: Toggle button that switches hypothesis truth value between TRUE and FALSE

controls.label: Conclusion: TRUE/FALSE
controls.description: Toggle button that switches conclusion truth value between TRUE and FALSE

controls.label: Random Example
controls.description: Cycles through 10 geometric conditional statement examples
